column5: LONDON  Oct 3 The time of big acquisitions and expensive projects at Severstal North America is over and the steelmaker will now focus on improving returns  the new chief executive said on Thursday.

column4: WRAPUP 8-Obama  congressional leaders still deadlocked on shutdown
column5: WASHINGTON  Oct 2 President Barack Obama met with Republican and Democratic leaders in Congress on Wednesday to try to break a budget deadlock that has shut wide swaths of the federal government  but there was no breakthrough and both sides blamed each other.

column4: CANADA STOCKS-TSX drops to near three-week low as U.S. gov't stays shut

column4: Vodafone CFO Halford to leave next year
column5: LONDON Britain's Vodafone  said on Thursday its chief financial officer Andy Halford will leave the group next year after the completion of its $130 billion deal to sell its U.S. wireless business to Verizon Communications Inc .

column4: Sam's Club CEO says seeing some sales weakness from U.S. furlough
column5: ROMEOVILLE  Illinois Sam's Club  the warehouse club chain owned by Wal-Mart Stores Inc   is seeing some softness in sales due to the furlough of federal government employees  though sales in stores near military bases could rise if military commissaries remain closed  Chief Executive Rosalind Brewer said on Thursday.

column4: India's Bharti to decide on fate of JV with Wal-Mart in October-report
column5: MUMBAI  Oct 3 Wal-Mart Stores Inc's  India partner  Bharti Enterprises  will take a call on the future of its wholesale joint venture with the U.S. retailer this month  the Economic Times said on Thursday.

column5: Oct 3 The following financial services industry appointments were announced on Thursday. To inform us of other job changes  email to moves@thomsonreuters.com.

column4: Westpac submits bid for Lloyds Australian assets - sources
column5: SYDNEY  Oct 3 Westpac Banking Corp has submitted a bid for  Australian assets being sold by Lloyds Banking Group  two sources said  lining up against competing offers from Pepper Australia and Macquarie Group .
